CANCELAR::TARDAR::tardío / tardía::tarde is used for a moment in time, tardío/a is used for timing
When the superlative is followed by a relative clause (usually with "que"), you use the subjunctive:
Why subjunctive? The subjunctive is used because the superlative expresses a subjective evaluation or judgment, and there's an element of doubt or emotional reaction involved.
Note: If you're stating an objective fact without the relative clause structure, you might use indicative:
Es la montaña más alta (It's the highest mountain) - just stating a fact
This is one of the more advanced uses of the subjunctive that Spanish learners encounter!
